question.title: Regex Pattern to Mask Field with Commas in Java
question.body:
I am working on a Java application that processes strings. I need to mask the content of a specific field. The challenge I'm facing is that this field sometimes contains commas, which interferes with my current masking pattern. Here is what I have so far:

Current regex pattern

field\s*=\s*([^,]*)

Example

field=I'm graduated from Comsats, Sahiwal,

Current output

field=******, Sahiwal,

Desired output

field=******,

Question

How can I construct a regex pattern in Java that properly masks the entire content of the field, stopping at that comma that indicates the end of the field? It should handle commas within the field value.
